PR #15238 is ready for review. Currently the file Adjoint.lean is too long, what should I do?

You can extend the allowed length of the file using set_option linter.style.longFile 1700.

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11365720479/job/31614511903?pr=15238#step:12:12
Do you also see a natural way to reorganize the file in smaller conceptual pieces that could be separate files?

Johan Commelin said:

Do you also see a natural way to reorganize the file in smaller conceptual pieces that could be separate files?

I'm not sure if Basic, and Algebraic is good, similar to that of IntermediateField file. The Basic only contains basic definitions and properties, Algebraic contains some results on algebraicity.

Results on AdjoinRoot and PowerBasis perhaps should go to another file? (AdjoinSimple.lean?)

And results on IntermediateField.FG perhaps should go to another file? (By the way, the fG in IntermediateField.fG_of_fG_toSubalgebra should be fg I think.)
I think a split into Basic and Algebraic is a good start.
